firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to securely manage devices and alerts by isolating each user's data within their own document path. All user-specific data (devices, alerts, etc.) is stored in subcollections under `/users/{userId}`. This path-based ownership model makes security rules simple and efficient, as access can be granted based on matching `request.auth.uid` with the `{userId}` wildcard in the path. This prevents any user from accessing another user's data and eliminates the possibility of broad, insecure queries on root collections.
